name: Eiffel Tower
description: Gustave Eiffel's iconic, wrought-iron 1889 tower, with steps and elevators to observation decks.

name: Louvre Museum
tagline: Landmark art museum with vast collection
description: Former historic palace housing huge art collection, from Roman sculptures to da Vinci's "Mona Lisa."

name: Notre-Dame de Paris
tagline: Iconic Gothic church with literary link
description: Towering, 13th-century cathedral with flying buttresses & gargoyles, setting for Hugo's novel.

name: Arc de Triomphe
description: Iconic triumphal arch built to commemorate Napoleon's victories, with an observation deck.

name: Champs-Élysées
tagline: Iconic site of landmarks, dining & shops
description: Famed route of landmarks such as the Louvre, Tuileries & Arc de Triomphe plus shops & restaurants.

name: Palace of Versailles
description: Immense, 18th-century palace with gilded apartments, chandeliered Hall of Mirrors & fountain show.

name: Sacré-Cœur, Paris
description: Iconic, domed white church, completed in 1914, with interior mosaics, stained-glass windows & crypt.

name: Montmartre
tagline: Basilica, Vincent van Gogh, and vineyard
description: Montmartre is a large hill in Paris's 18th arrondissement. It is 130 m high and gives its name to the surrounding district, part of the Right Bank in the northern section of the city. The historic

name: Place de la Concorde
description: Major public square, scene of executions, decorated with fountains, statues & an Egyptian obelisk.

name: Musée d'Orsay
description: Major 19th- & 20th-century European art collections housed in a monumental, former railway station.

name: Le Marais
tagline: Shopping, fashion, street art, swamp, and art
description: Le Marais is a historic district in Paris, France. Long the aristocratic district of Paris, it hosts many outstanding buildings of historic and architectural importance. It spreads across parts

name: Tuileries Garden
description: Expansive, 17th-century formal garden dotted with statues, including 18 bronzes by Maillol.

name: Jardin du Luxembourg
description: 17th-century park with formally laid-out gardens, trees planted in patterns & statues on pedestals.

name: Centre Georges Pompidou
description: Architecturally avant-garde complex housing National Museum of Modern Art, library and music center.

name: Moulin Rouge
description: Famed 19th-century cabaret featuring Belle Epoque decor, dinner & dancers in elaborate costumes.

name: Disneyland Paris
tagline: Iconic amusement park with themed rides
description: Theme park complex featuring family-friendly rides, shows and costumed characters, plus hotels.

name: Latin Quarter, Paris
description:
The Latin Quarter of Paris is an area in the 5th and the 6th arrondissements of Paris. It is situated on the left bank of the Seine, around the Sorbonne.
Known for its student life, lively atmosphere

name: Les Invalides
description: Series of army museums including a church & the tombs of many famed officers, including Napoleon.

name: Île de la Cité
description: This Parisian isle connected by the ancient Pont Neuf bridge is home to the Notre Dame cathedral.

name: Sainte-Chapelle
description: Ornate, 13th-century, Gothic chapel with relics & notable stained-glass windows of biblical scenes.

name: Champ de Mars
description: Landscaped park with paths & trees, bird life, extensive lawns & a children's play area.

name: Père Lachaise Cemetery
tagline: Well-known graves in leafy burial site
description: Vast tree-lined burial site with famous names including Oscar Wilde, Jim Morrison & Maria Callas.

name: Catacombs of Paris
tagline: Tunnel complex for millions of skeletons
description: Illuminated labyrinth in former limestone mine with millions of ghoulishly arranged skeletons.

name: Saint-Germain-des-Prés
description: Saint-Germain-des-Prés is one of the four administrative quarters of the 6th arrondissement of Paris, France, located around the church of the former Abbey of Saint-Germain-des-Prés. Its official

name: Grand Palais
description: Art nouveau hall with domed glass roof, built in 1900, hosting exhibitions and cultural events.

name: Panthéon
description: 18th-century mausoleum with colonnaded facade, housing remains of notable French citizens.

name: Tour Montparnasse
description: Modern 210m tower with panoramic views from roof terrace and 56th-floor observation deck.

name: Place de la Bastille
tagline: Bustling square where prison once stood
description: The July Column rises above this iconic square's bars & cafes, former site of the Bastille prison.

name: Conciergerie
description: Gothic, riverside fortress & French Revolution prison, housing Marie Antoinette's former cell.

name: Palais Garnier
description: Italian-style opera house with ceiling painted by Chagall & library museum in 19th-century building.

name: Place des Vosges
description: Oldest planned square in Paris, lined with trees and red brick houses, built by Henri IV in 1612.

name: La Défense
tagline: Joan Miró, sculpture, shopping, and art
description: La Défense is a major business district, three kilometres west of the city limits of Paris. It is part of the Paris Metropolitan Area in the Île-de-France region, located in the department Hauts

name: Musée de l'Orangerie
description: Museum with 20th-century European art collection, showcasing 8 of Monet's water lilies murals.

name: Canal Saint-Martin
description: The Canal Saint-Martin is a 4.6 km long canal in Paris, connecting the Canal de l'Ourcq to the river Seine. Over nearly half its length, between the Rue du Faubourg du Temple and the Place de

name: Bastille
description: The Bastille was a fortress in Paris, known formally as the Bastille Saint-Antoine. It played an important role in the internal conflicts of France and for most of its history was used as a state

name: Pont Neuf
tagline: Stone bridge with a statue of Henri IV
description: Arched stone bridge, opened in 1607, with 2 spans & a bronze, equine statue of King Henri IV.

name: Rue de Rivoli
description: Rue de Rivoli is one of the most famous streets in Paris, a commercial street whose shops include the most fashionable names in the world. It bears the name of Napoleon's early victory against

name: Jardin des plantes
description: Vast park with plant species grown in botanical & alpine gardens & restored 19th-century hothouses.

name: Musée Rodin
description: 18th-century mansion & sculpture garden displaying Rodin's influential works, such as The Thinker.

name: Île Saint-Louis
description:
The Île Saint-Louis is one of two natural islands in the Seine river, in Paris, France.
The Île Saint-Louis is connected to the rest of Paris by four bridges to both banks of the river and to

name: Les Halles
description: Les Halles was Paris's central fresh food market. It was demolished in 1971 and replaced by the Forum des Halles, a modern shopping mall built largely underground and directly connected to the

name: Place Charles de Gaulle
description: square in Vernon, France

name: Musée Picasso
description: 17th-century building holding 5,000 artworks by Pablo Picasso, his own art collection & archive.

name: Louvre Pyramid
tagline: Iconic glass pyramid leading to museum
description: Glass pyramid created by I. M. Pei, forming the entranceway into a lower-ground exhibition area.

name: Bois de Boulogne
tagline: Vast, historic park with botanic gardens
description: Former royal hunting grounds, now a huge public park with lakes, nature trails & botanical gardens.

name: Pont Alexandre III
tagline: Arched bridge with art nouveau lamps
description: Ornate, late 19th-century arched bridge in a Beaux Arts style & named after a Russian czar.

name: Pont des Arts
description: Picturesque bridge over the Seine connecting the Louvre & the Institut de France.

name: Palais-Royal
description: Palace & gardens with 17th-century arcades of shops & Daniel Buren's striped columns in courtyard.

name: Parc de la Villette
description: Wide lawns with sculptures and fountains in urban park with a museum, a cinema and a music complex.

name: Place Vendôme
tagline: Louis XIV of France and architecture
description: Place Vendôme is a square in the 1st arrondissement of Paris, France, located to the north of the Tuileries Gardens and east of the Église de la Madeleine. It is the starting point of the rue
